Events that occurred on 4 September.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1918 - J.R.R. Tolkien attends a medical board examination in Kingston-upon-Hull.
1936 - German translator Hans J. Schütz is born
1950 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 128a.
1957 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 200a.
1957 - J.R.R. Tolkien meets with some American producers interested in making an animated version of The Lord of the Rings (see Letter 201).
1960 - The Fellowship of the Ring becomes formally constituted.
1968 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Mary Fairburn.
1970 – The first Mythcon is held at Harvey Mudd College in Claremont, California.
1971 - Mythcon 2 in Santa Barbara, California.
1982 - The eighth episode of the new version of the 1981 radio series of The Lord of the Rings is aired on BBC Radio 4.
2020 - A second edition of The First and Second Ages is published.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 3018:
Gandalf is held captive by Saruman on the pinnacle of Orthanc.
Boromir travels towards Rivendell to ask for counsel.
